page.title: 08COASTAL ECOLOGY
page.content: Basically, the beach running from the base of the cliff to the sea can be divided into three sections. Firstly, at the base of the cliff, the shore consists of large pebbles rounded by the sea and boulders which have broken off and fallen from the cliff itself. The remains of dry sea weed are present and also limpet, mussel and periwinkle shells. Secondly, there is the rock area. Here, sea snails, barnacles, limpets, whelks, winkles and periwinkles as well as small crabs are present in the rock pools. Sea weeds such as sea lettuce, egg spiral and serrated wrack are abundant. Thirdly, before the sea, is a stretch of sand. Here, at low tide, are the markings of lugworms, with one or two small remains of sea lettuce and other floating sea weeds.
